issue.title: Probable issue in diffdrive inbuilt plugin

content.raw:
Short info: please go through the bold texts.

Detailed:
Ok
Let us turn the bot clock wise from top view and stop. And go straight as in simply cmd_vel linear.x=1

It is recreatable 100 times it will try to turn clock wise if done linear.x=1 after that.

Same thing can be done with, if turning it anti clock wise, stopped and every time bot will try to turn anti clock wise if done linear.x=1.

Turn means angular. z=0.1 or -0.1.

It seems normal at first sight. However, after the bot stopped, all the forces should have stabilized and should not continue to force bot to turn to any side if commanded to go straight.

There may be something conceptually wrong with me or something wrong with the simulation. I need to clarify both the cases. I mean bot should not turn at all when it should go straight. The caster is also fixed at center. Driver wheels are identical. What possibly applying force on last turned direction only.

**On top of these the simulation or world reset doesn't help here once the bot turned. The gazebo has to be restarted.
**

I might be wrong, and want to grasps the underlying concepts to simulate such an event.

If I imagine, in ideal world this is not natural. And simulation should follow same thing.

**The expectation is linear.x=1. But once the turn angular.z=0.1 given, then all zeros, wait for the bot to stop completely and then the linear.x=1 behaves like ( linear.x=1 and angular.z=0.1 ).** 

I can share another video demonstrating the same in an orthogonal view. Another way is to launch the repo linked in the first comment.
